Reviews.Title: “Big rooms on a nice location”
Reviews.Author: jlmoura
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin for a business meeting and stayed one night at the Mandala. Staff was incredibly nice and helpful and the room was very spacious. I stayed at the Executive Suite with separate living room and a huge bathroom. Overall it feels very German. Clean lines and everything works, but it lacks a bit of soul. What impressed me the most was the restaurant were they served breakfast. You enter this very stylish glass cube with linen table cloths and china and huge vases pouring water I felt I need to return to have dinner there. Next time I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: FrusaChicago
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 4 nights at the Mandala Hotel with our sons (ages 8 and 10). The hotel is great -- very modern, comfortable large rooms and the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We took two rooms (they have none that are connecting unfortunately), which were good value and included an excellent breakfast in the 5th floor solarium (very nice). The only contstructive criticism I would offer is that the "concierge" services were uneven. All of the reception staff offers concierge type services, but we found some that had only basic knowledge while others were much better versed in what Berlin has to offer -- including recommending a great, off-the-beaten track restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: DJKryser
Reviews.Content: Great location near most WW2 sites. Very nice interiors although I would have liked some more warmth in the rooms. Breakfast is very good and staff is friendly. Beds are too low though. I highly recommend it if you are looking for a boutique/private experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, polite and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: h00ked0ntravel
Reviews.Content: Mandala is well located with the S-Bahn and U-Bahn just 5 mins walk from the hotel. There is also a shopping mall 1 min away from the hotel, which has a supermarket at the basement, making it easy to stock up on amenities. The room is large by European standards, is well maintained and comes with free Wifi, a kitchenette (hot plates, utensils and all) and a large bathroom. It was outfitted like a business hotel given the business desk, radio and amenities in the room but this was not unexpected given the commercial buildings surrounding the hotel. Upon checking in, we only found 1 set of everything (pillows, towels etc) but 1 phone call and 5-10 mins later, housekeeping promptly showed up at our door with a second set of everything (including bathrobe, comforter and everything we didn't think we about). We were out most of the day so we did not make use of the services in the hotel, but the front desk staff were very helpful, polite and enthusiastic with helping us. One even ran out into the cold to hail a taxi for us as we were leaving. The one and only thing that annoyed us was the credit card guarantee system. We had already paid up our hotel stay in full the day we checked in. The hotel insisted on a credit card to guarantee our stay chargeable at US50 per day. This was indeed common practice as with all other 5 star and boutique hotels. However, most of the other hotels we stayed in would only proceed to hold the amount (i.e. block the amount so you cannot spend it) and not charge the card. Here, the hotel charged us EU100 on Day 1 and credited EU100 on Day 3. This resulted in our losing out in the forex of EU against our home currency, which was mighty annoying because ultimately the credit card guys are the only ones who benefit from this arrangement. Hopefully the hotel will look into this for future customers of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Zen”
Reviews.Author: Angel2001
Reviews.Content: I won't repeat what many others have said about the exemplary service. breakfast and location, but instead say that this hotel, where I have stayed for 5 nights at the Berlin Film Festival every year for the last 3 years, has the most restful and beautiful rooms and common areas. We loved having breakfast at Facil under the atrium, where every details has been chosen for its natural colour and beauty - from the heavy bronze plates, fountain urns and hand-blown glasses, to the etchings on the walls. The food at the Mandala is sensational, and there is no better hotel I've stayed at in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish boutique with prime real estate”
Reviews.Author: Breeze_n_Palm_Trees
Reviews.Content: The Mandala hotel can be best described as a stylish hotel next or not too far from everything. Accommodation: The hotel itself is super sleek and stylish and seems to use its space well. There isn't a main lobby so when there is more than 5+ people checking in/out or waiting for an elevator it can get a touch crammed but that's what a boutique hotel is and not a deal breaker in my view. As the hotel is encased in glass, the elevator ride is fairly cool as you can see the Sony Centre and people doing their thing. The first floor has a lounge that sets the tone for a laid back sit-down for drinks and a small bite or a good primer to start your evening. On the top floor is the ONO spa, exercise room, and tanning bed. The exercise room has a good range of equipment, weights and cardio machines to choose from and a lot better than most hotels tend to offer. The spa offers steam rooms and showers, lounge area, and a path of stones on the balcony which vary in size and shape. The exercise room and the steam rooms are free for guests. The spa also offers massage and other esthetic packages which is at an additional cost. I would have appreciated a jacuzzi or small pool but still a relaxing atmosphere. The breakfast on the 5th floor called Facil restaurant offers a good variety breakfast with a handful of freshly squeezed juices, traditional European selection of cold cuts etc and eggs and bacon made to order. Some might think the breakfast is a little steep, and there are nearby restos that can solve that problem. The rooms are spacious with a big balcony, queen-sized bed, tv, lounge chair, desk area, sizeable washroom with bathtub, walk-in closet, coffee-maker, mini fridge and even a little two-range stove top should you decide you needed to heat something up on a whim. I share someone's opinion on the pillows being a little too soft for my liking, but once again, not a big deal. Location x3 Is really what this place is all about as you are within walking distance of the Sony Centre right in front, the Berlin Film Festival Office on the left, and a 3 tier shopping centre called Arcadia offering good eats (including desserts), fashion from Hilfiger to Lauren, Zara to G-Star, Puma to H&M. This is all within 100 metres. Within a short distance walk is some of the main attractions like the Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie, the Memorial, and even a Salvador Dali museum. The Subway is a cheap, simple and nearby alternative that are can get you everywhere else. The Wrap-up All in all, it was an excellent stay. The hotel is sleek, the staff are incredible and pleasant from the check-in desk to the servers..and with the hotel being situated in such a prime location, there wasn't much need to search too far to not only see some of the memorable sites of Berlin, but take some of it back with you.

Reviews.Title: “Location: A+, Service: A+, Room A+”
Reviews.Author: Shuguh
Reviews.Content: First trip to Berlin, a city we found very hard to "figure out" prior to our arrival, but without a doubt we hit the bull's-eye with Hotel Mandala [pronounced man-dah-LAH in Berlin]. I would recommend this well-run and stylish hotel to both short- and long-term guests. The large rooms with closets galore and affordable rates would make it an ideal choice for a long-term stay. The entire area is all glass-encased new construction [read: no shortage of Starbucks and the like] as this area was literally a no-man's land when the Wall was standing. However it is a short walk to the Berliner Tor [Brandenberg Gate] and Unter den Linden, the main boulevard of Mitte [or "middle"] and is also just a few steps to the delightful Tiergarten Park. On the downside your are in the "middle" of nowhere, in a way, being between the two sides of Berlin. What this means is cabs, which were not terribly expensive. Whatever you do, do not miss the very moving Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe which is a two or three minute walk from the hotel. A stone's throw from this memorial is the site of Hitler's bunker, thankfully now filled in, above which is currently a non-descript car park. Nothing demonstrated the splintered history of this city more than this strange juxtaposition. The hotel shares the building with other entities, so the ground floor entrance to the hotel is a small doorway directly next to the Berlin Film Festival Offices. There is a small lobby on the ground floor, but the bulk of the hotel is on the upper floors of the building (reached via a glass elevator overlooking the Sony Centre across Potsdamer Straße) including the restaurant, Facil, on the fifth floor and the ONO spa on the eleventh (top) floor. The staff was top notch, embodying that rare combination of being both handsome and helpful. They had the foresight to anticipate our needs and the knowledge to fulfill them. I can't say enough good things about each and every person we encountered at the front desk. Perhaps my opinion of the front desk is tainted by the very generous room upgrade they gave us, from a 50sqm Management Suite to a rather capacious 80 sqm Grand Suite. The glass-enclosed balcony alone was massive with fancy-schmancy electric louvered windows which wouldn't be out of place in a James Bond film. The main part of the room was large and then meandered around to the bedroom/bathroom and the adjoining closet area, meaning an area literally full of open closets. One small complaint, the very stylized tub offered no intuitive way to get the water from the bath to the shower. My friends at the front desk were very helpful, and I sensed I wasn't the first (or last) person to be flummoxed by this vexing plumbing fixture. The breakfast at Facil was simply heaven. The level of service and the wide range of food (all delicious) made this the ne plus ultra of hotel breakfasts. I suggest trying to arrive at non-peak times, as the demand for tables was higher than the supply. The ONO spa is very stylish and offers saunas (no wet heat) and a relaxing area with million dollar views of Berlin. Like most Americans, our knowledge of European history is spotty, at best, so the hotel was able to engage a tour guide named Peter who was a Berlin-native. This was the best money we have ever spent as in three hours we "got" Berlin in terms of both its history and its evolution. I highly recommend this intelligent personalized approach for Berlin neophytes over the slightly less expensive tour groups.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Suzibanter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to Potsdamer Platz train station and the Sony Centre. Plenty of restaurants and bars in the vicinity. Hotel is very modern, smooth and sleek. Staff were polite and very helpful. The cocktail bar on the first floor is great to start the night. The room was large and comfortable. Sofa and chairs, writing desk and balcony. Huge bathroom, well stocked wtih towels and robes. Spa on the top floor. I had a full back and neck massage - it was excellent. The breakfasts were delicious. Plenty of buffet style food and a hot choice of eggs, any style and bacon. Great views from the smaller of the dining rooms. would love to return to Berlin, 3 days not long enough to see all the sights, and I would definately stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfectly Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louise M
Reviews.Content: The Mandela Hotel is an excellent hotel. It is ideally situated for tourists wishing to do a spot of sightseeing or shopping. The suites are spacious, well appointment and are well maintained. The staff are very friendly, professional and helpful. The spa is the perfect way to relax after a long day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: jim_ontheroad2011
Reviews.Content: First trip to Berlin and the hotel selection was a home run, yup we are American. The location, room, spa, breakfast and staff were among the very best we have experienced home or abroad. We received assistance with restaurant booking prior to our visit and thoughtful service through out our stay. Not sure when we will return to Berlin but Mandala will be our choice.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect haven in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: SaranLinda
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just gorgeous. Attention to detail in the hotels design carried through to their service. Great location in Potsdamer Platz. Was right next to a Christmas market as well. We stayed in a Studio room that was very spacious. Bath in the bathroom and ample storage in the wardrobe. I particular liked how sweet the whole hotel smelt - very homely and relaxing. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone going to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: outthayr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 weeks. Good location, right off Potsdamer Platz, close to restaurants, movie theater, shops, ubahn. Great staff, great facilities - spa, gym. Terrific breakfast buffet, so delicious, looked forward to it every morning. The QIU lounge was very nice environment, friendly bartenders, and the chef would fix you whatever you wanted. The only negative was housekeeping; there are little buttons on the wall which you push to make a light come on outside your door indicating whether or not you want your room serviced. It seems the housekeeping staff would totally ignore the lights and just come in and clean the room. They would move things all around if the room wasn't dirty, just so their presence would be known. They also TOOK a spoon which I had bought out in the market. I assume the thought it was the hotel's. The spoon was never returned to me. Aside from the annoying housekeeping and the fact that I told the front desk FOUR times for the housekeeping NOT to clean unless I requested it, everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Theodora-x
Reviews.Content: The rooms at The Mandala are spacious and beautifully styled with attention to detail which includes a kitchinette and a hifi system with cool composition CDs provided. The breakfast is also very good and again attention to detail is key from the direction of the serving spoons to the continuous replenishment of food. The hotel is clean and without clutter - the owners have a nack for selecting key designer features. The staff are friendly and helpful. The location is also perfect for getting to landmarks and if you do not like walking the station is 1 minute away.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: p2t
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Mandala and it remains my favorite hotel in the city. Much of Berlin is within walking distance regardless of whether you choose to head east or west. The rooms are comfortable and good-sized. The level of maintainance and upkeep is very high -- I was surprised to learn that the hotel has been open as long as it has. You do not see much wear and tear in the building or in the room. The quality of service is high and the rooms are well-aportioned. It is clear why the Mandala is popular with people in Berlin on extended stays. The kitchenettes are nice and the work space is comfortable. We grabbed a drink in the bar this time and were impressed by the quality of the drinks and staff. I look forward to getting back to the Mandala again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service—a fine establishment!”
Reviews.Author: BeenThereEatenThat
Reviews.Content: This really is a quality hotel. And the quality goes way beyond just looking the business. The staff are so courteous, professional and friendly. Sometimes when I enter higher-end establishments they look me up and down as I resemble a caveman. But not these guys. Awesome loveliness. It goes a long way. Room service is what really separates the hotel "men" from the "boys." We ordered a caesar with organic chicken and a steak sandwich with fries. This was very relaxed food for an equally relaxed setting - but it was prepared with love, care and attention—seasoned to perfection. Delicious. As good as I could have made it myself and, as a dedicated cook, I don't say that lightly! The room was great. We ordered an Executive Suite and took advantage of the instant upgrade upon arrival. It was factored into our booking but there definitely seems to be an "easy upgrade" culture thriving in this hotel, especially if you walk in with a smile on your face. Location was perfect, just around the corner from a beautiful Christmas market and lots of restaurant choices. This is my new Berlin home! Thank you Mandala Hotel! We'll be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: MH64
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the centre of things, a few yards from Potsdamer Platz, yet perfectly quiet in the room. We spent a weekend here and walked everywhere, from Alexanderplatz in the East to the Ku'damm in the West. We took an Executive room which had a sitting area and kitchen area, desk and walk in wardrobe. Free wifi, balcony and a lovely king sized bed made our time in the room as relaxing and pleasant as the sightseeing outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JeanJeanJean35
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Mandala and I find it hard to fault. Location, service, rooms - modern, spacious, clean, comfortable - and restaurant are all superb.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and expensive for Berlin standards”
Reviews.Author: jrovero
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Mandala for five nights because we found a good deal to this hotel trough Jetseter. It was our first time in Berlin and after walking the whole city for several days we found many more hotels with much nicer and not so frivolous service. Even the Ritz Carlton offered us a better rate with brakefast included. Here is 35 euros per person per day on top of our already expensive rate. Small reception and unfriendly staff. Spend your money somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: archetipo69
Reviews.Content: I was at the Mandala recently for a couple of days in Berlin. The rooms are very confortable and large, fully equipped and location is perfect. The staff was very helpfull and nice. I didn't try the restaurant but heard good things about it. It was a pleasant experience, thanks to Luc and all the other members of staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing amazing amazing”
Reviews.Author: emzi1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Mandala Hotel for a quick weekend away from London and found the hotel on a deal through Voyage Privee. The hotels is STUNNING! My standards are quite high and I like staying in nice places. The Mandala was faultless. We had an executive suite and could fault nothing apart from maybe the pillows which were a little thin. The suite was huge, modern and clean. Everything was enormous and had it have been a little warmer we could have used the well sized balcony too. Breakfast was amazing, with the biggest range of foods from hot good, fruits, anti pasta, pastries, all kinds of juices and even champagne. The location is second to none (opposite the Sony Centre). The bar serves the best cocktails i've ever had and for 7 euros each we thought they were well priced for what you get. the staff are helpful and discreet. 5 star and more! we will be booking again next year without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel on vibrant location”
Reviews.Author: Marc D
Reviews.Content: very nice rooms with balcony perfect breakfast in design environment wonderful spa very frienddly staff small lobby and a chair at the public pc would be helpful having free wifi would make 5 dotts

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great atmosphere and the best breakfast ever”
Reviews.Author: Madlen N
Reviews.Content: It is a really lovely hotel, right next to Potsdamer Platz with very friendly staff. I stayed in the 10th floor in a very spacious suite with a balcony - lovely view -, a very big bathroom and a large walk-in closet. Plus the spa was just one floor above. I really liked the decoration and atmosphere of the hotel and the best was definitely the breakfast. Not only lots of fresh fruits, breads, cakes to choose from but also waffles, pancakes, eggs and a large choice of fresh juices. One morning we even sat outside in the garden.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: claudz00
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel a few weeks ago and I can't praise it enough. The location is perfect, right opposite the Sony centre, 20 m to the metro station and within walking distance of a lot of the major attractions. The hotel is, as described, understated luxury, very stylish and contemporary. The room was spacious, very clean and extremely well appointed. The buffet breakfast is fantastic, with lots of variety to cater for all needs. The setting is also very stylish and tasteful. At night, it's the Fine restaurant, a 1 hat, Michelin restaurant. There are also laundry rooms on a few floors equipped with Miele appliances, ironing board, with every washing powder imaginable and even a TV in the rooms! I found this extremely handy as I was getting to the end of my clean clothes! The service is free. The staff in all areas of the hotel are very friendly, professional and extremely helpful. An outstanding hotel, will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Gourmand_nl
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the small hotel reception you can not fail to immediately notice that the personel at the Mandala Hotel is there to make your stay perfect. The rooms are modern, large, clean and comfortable. Most have some sort of mini-kitchen and a walk in closet. The bathroom is large, clean and comfortable. I stayed in a normal room for a conference once and had a larger suite during our last visit with my wife and 9 months ols son. The hotel provided a baby bed. On two evenings we needed a babysitter. The hotel contacted a really nice and reliable lady that looked after our son (the hourly rate of 19,50€ was not cheap). The self service breakfast buffet is one of the best I have ever seen in a hotel with lots of delicious liitle thing. The breakfast staff continiously takes care that everthing on the buffet and your table is perfect. In the evening the same room serves as Michelin star restaurant that is well worth visiting. I like the hotel bar. It is quite small. It serves good wines and nice snacks. It is a good place to have some drinks before going to dinner in the city or to have a drink after you have returned from the city. The Mandala is located across the Sony Center, near the Postdamer Platz. Public transport at the Potsdamer Platz station connects you to very spot in Berlin and the Brandenburger Tor, Reichstag, The Holocaust Memorial and Unter der Linden are all at walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: Excellent, great location, and the suite we stayed in was perfect, large, clean, good view and very well appointed. Staff were very helpful, especially with the parking. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “5-stars? Not in my opinion”
Reviews.Author: NYCSPOON
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice enough - clean and spacious rooms but overall, expensive and overrated. Location is nothing special though it is close to a metro station. The staff was extremely rude to me on several occasions. One afternoon, I arranged with the front desk for a taxi at 7 pm (the city can get busy and it's good to call ahead for taxis)....taxi did not arrive and when I inquired with front desk, discovered there was no record of me ordering one. Was late for a very important meeting as had to wait for doorman to flag a taxi. The spa is HORRIBLE. Paid over 100 euro for possible the worst massage of my life. Facial I had scheduled with the spa was also not on the books so did not receive- probably a blessing as facial likely as disastrous and more expensive than massage.

Reviews.Title: “Balcony & Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Sam_NW_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Executive Superior Suite with a small kitchenette & possibly the largest balcony I have ever seen, sweeping round the room to allow brilliant views. Breakfast was of an excellent quality but didn't dine at the restaurant in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay for a business or leisure trip”
Reviews.Author: krzys1970
Reviews.Content: I was staying at this hotel for more than 10 times already, each time while visiting Berlin. The hotel has spacious romms/appartments with a small kitchenette. The fitness/spa area located on the top floor provides for all you need after an exhausting day. Breakfast is served in the dining room and it offers wide variety of choices. Staff is friendly an helpful. The hotel is affordable for family stays in terms of pricing, except of busy festival and trade seasons.

Reviews.Title: “The best breakfast in town !”
Reviews.Author: Frank_and_Barbara
Reviews.Content: We chose the Mandala because of the best price for a suite in this category of hotels. The suite was not a real two room suite, but finaly it worked out fine because our son was tired. Service was great, valet parking friendly staff. Room very clean and a nice bed for our son. The breakfast was one of the best breakfast in Hotels we ever had, and we had a lot!!! Salmon the best.... quality of the food in general, first class. Very friendly service ...

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Clean & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: GreenCheeze
Reviews.Content: Higly recommend this hotel for either business or pleasure. Everything in order, good service & on-site bar/dining. We had a Jr. Suite which had more than enough room for our family of three (son used extra bed brought in) & had mini cooking space (stovetop, sink, hot water pot, a few dishes, a fridge with minibar essentials - but no microwave). Good location - it is walking distance to key sights in Mitte and it is very easy to find something to eat at any price point throughout the day. Next to Potsdammer Platz S- and U- stations, 85 and 200 bus lines, mall shops & grocery store, English & German cinemas, Lego Land (at Sony Center).

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: juliewoodie
Reviews.Content: I have been to Berlin several times, staying in various hotels including the Raddison Blu which has a similar star rating . This Hotel was by far , a nicer hotel . The room (a management suite ) was one of the best i have ever stayed in.( and I have stayed in many of the"leading hotels of the world" ) Looking at the layout I am guessing that one suite used to be two rooms when it was the Madison Hotel , which gives you an idea of its size . And, in addition to this ,there was a balcony. I notice a few people commented on the small reception area ,and indeed , it is very small . However since i have no desire to be lolling about in hotel lobbies I did not see this as a problem at all . Also the people who commented on the shabby carpet in the corridor must have been on a different floor (or different hotel !!) than me as it looked brand new on the 7th floor . If I had to find fault , and this is a tiny niggle , I would have liked some seating on the balcony

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, loved every moment.”
Reviews.Author: asoccermom
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel with perfect, fabulous service. Best breakfast I have ever eaten in my life. Everything about this hotel is spot-on. I would have loved my soap, toiletries etc., to have been replaced daily, but they don't seem to do this in Europe. Fairly central location, right beside a very average mall, and with a bus stop at the front door. Service was impeccable. My husband would have loved a single duvet (they put 2 single duvets on a king bed) along with fluffier pillows, but this was a very minor inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Meri007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in early June, 2011. The hotel is in an excellent location with lots of restaurants, cafes and two (english) movie theaters nearby. The Potsdamer Platz Ubahn (subway) is around the corner from the hotel. It is also walking distrance to Brandenburg Tor, Berliner Dome, Checkpoint Charlie, etc. The hotel provides great service. We reserved a room from Jetsetter.com and got a great deal on a suite. It was very spacious, modern deco and a huge bathroom and sitting area. The bed was very comfortable with a white goose-down comforter. Felt like you were sleeping on a cloud. Also, The hotel provides free internet. There is a beautiful spa and gym. You can't go wrong staying at this hotel. I would definitely return for another visit. It's about a 25 minute cab ride from Tegel airport and will cost about 20 euros. Oh one more thing, we took the Ubahn to Kreuzberg and ate at a mexican restaurant called Maria Peligro. Excellent food and margaritas. Wouldn't think you would find this in Germany.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff - but not quite 5*”
Reviews.Author: Catcake
Reviews.Content: Firstly I must say that the staff at the Mandala are excellent. They are efficient, courteous and helpful and made us feel incredibly welcome. There are no snooty attitudes here - only dedication to good service. Our room, which was a City Studio booked on a deal with Voyage Prive was very nicely appointed. It was modern, clean and unfussy with an excellent walk in wardrobe and kitchenette area. The biggest downside to the City Studios is that they are plagued by the exceptionally noisy main road down beneath. We had to have the windows open because the climate control temperature did not go down low enough in the room - the noise is unbearable. So whilst the city views are quite exciting, please do consider whether noise would be an issue for you. I believe the Garden studios face inwards, away from the road and are probably quieter. Breakfast was included in our stay, and because of this was good value. It was an excellent buffet and we enjoyed it very much. I believe it's quite pricey if not included with your room rate - and probably not worth it. Potsdamer Platz is a great location - some touristy (and so overpriced) eateries in the Sony Centre complex opposite are OK. The Heisser Wolf is great if you want some Currywurst and a lovely beer. Look further afield for better value eats. The rest of the city is easily accessible - we did a lot of walking (The Brandenburg Gate is only a 10-12 minute walk) and the nearby S-Bahn/U-Bahn can take you to most places you need to go. Try out the city bus tours - the hotel will sell you tickets for this at reception. The hotel bar is lovely - we took advantage of the Cocktail deal vouchers we were presented with on check in and enjoyed a couple of well made cocktails on our first night. All in all, a great place to base yourself in whilst in Berlin, but not quite the opulence you may expect from a 5* establishment. It's more like a high-end business hotel. However, the staff make up for this by being absolutely fantastic throughout the whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “We got bumped...”
Reviews.Author: sharmalita
Reviews.Content: I was very unimpressed with this hotel and the service....after walking up at 4am to catch a flight to Berlin and getting to the hotel, we were told that they had guests staying longer from the night before and no booking for us and we stay in their sister place which is apartments - a complete step down in a different area. We had spent ages choosing the area to stay in and this hotel...As we had no other choice, we had to ask them to arrange a taxi to get to the other hotel and when we got there they said no rooms till the afternoon. There was no apology or even offer of a refund in the room rates considering one was a 4* hotel and the other 3* apartments. Luckily our travel agent called as we got to the Mandala Suites and found us an amazing hotel staying at The Grand Hyatt. I was dismayed that any hotel would just bump you like that and not even bother calling you.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel, friendly service - will go again”
Reviews.Author: Nehal82
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with this hotel, the hotel staff were fantastic. Daniel made us feel very welcome. I honestly cannot fault the service, people smile and are friendly. I had a few queries regarding tickets, finding the best prices, tickets etc. and the staff would go to great lengths to try and help you. The hotel was sample in size, the walk in room is great. I didn't find a huge difference between management suite and executive, so stuck to the cheaper management. The balcony window overlooked the Bahnof building, fantastic views at night. The bed is comfortable, and the AC, kitchen utility, shower were all of a high standard. The hotel provides free internet in the bar and lobby (with printer), which proved useful for us. The location is fantastic, just a short walk from the major cafes, we were at Cafe a Gelato nearly every day!

Reviews.Title: “Great for both business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: Sarah503830
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice at the Mandala in April/May, the first time for leisure (I have known the hotel from the past) and once for business. It is great for both, I like the fact that every room has a decent sized fridge and small kitchen area, so if you are staying a few days you can buy drinks and snacks and store them. Breakfast is gorgeous but expensive, so if you are staying a few days, just pop next door to the supermarket and get some cereal and milk for breakfast - they are fine about providing cutlery and crockery. Rooms are modern and minimalist but still cosy, and the bathrooms are lovely. Gym is good but if you want fresh air you are just round the corner from the Tiergarten which is great for running. A nice addition to my recent stay was their new organinic shampoos & shower gel etc which really impressed me. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: TotoSurrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of March/beginning of April and would highly recommend it. Great location, helpful staff and would definitley stay here again on our next visit to Berlin - and we are definitley going back as we had such a good time in Berlin - so much to see and do here. There is a little kitchenette - kettle, a good sized fridge, and a little electric hob too. Bathroom is nice and big with all the toiletries you need - although they are a little on the basic side. Big comfy double bed but with one single duvet each - see photo which I have hopefully managed to attach to this report. All decorated beautifully throughout.

Reviews.Title: “A most fabalous experience with the best restuarant and staff”
Reviews.Author: Jungle_Johnny186
Reviews.Content: We arraived at the Mandala and received with all efficiency you would ex[ect from a German hotel. The staff were extremely pleasant and attentative, from the recepetion staff to the maids. Very spacious rooms well laid out with good size bathrooms. The breakfast is a definite must and worth every penny. The restuarant staff were of the highest callibre and the food was devine. It is michelin starred breakfast. If you have a chance to eat here - we can only recommend you do. We ate in the restuarant on the first night of our stay and then struggled to find anywhere as delicious or as attentaive - the staff were excellent and the choice of wines with the meal selected by the staff complimented the food extremely well. I can only recommend you stay and just enjpy the space and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Anthi1
Reviews.Content: The accommodation was great, large room, super service. We had a problem with our luggage that was provoked in the airport and they solved it and we didnt lose a second from our trip.

Reviews.Title: “A really comfortable stay in one of the best locations in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: RAskWar
Reviews.Content: After trying a number of different hotel in Berlin over the last years, I booked with the Mandala last week, during IHIF and ITB events. I was really satisfied with everything from the warm welcome, the spacious rooms with e.g. very good working conditions, funky bar/restaurant (with free wifi) & the friendly atmosphere, which is not always the case with the 'design' hotels. A really enjoyable hotel experience. Will come back, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Suite”
Reviews.Author: BLUE5KY
Reviews.Content: Very well located at Potsdamer Platz and close to subways. The suite/room is stunning, generous in size and beautifully designed with a separate lounge area, kitchen facility, comfy bed and huge bathroom. Made my 6 night stay in Berlin blissful. Oh, and a massive walk-in wadrobe. Staff are friendly and helpful. They even smile which I found is not usual in Berlin. Behind the hotel is a modern shopping mall for all your needs and some more. There is an Asian restaurant across the road next to the Ritz-Carlton Hotel for very good Asian food. Made this Australian Chinaman happy. But do have their werld famous sausages.

Reviews.Title: “Functional and great location, but not luxurious by any means”
Reviews.Author: Asta72
Reviews.Content: Rating: A rather un-inspired strong 3. The hotel fills it´s function and is pleasant enough Location: Very conveniently located right on Potzdamer Platz. If you´re into classical music you can´t beat this location unless you stay at the Hyatt!) as it´s literally a 2 minute walk from the Philharmonie. You´re also very close to some big theatres and shows + of course the Reichtag and Brandenburger Tor + Unter den Linden. Very close to the U-bahn. Hotel: Seems to be fairly newly renovated. The entrance is very discreet and the reception is tiny and crammed into a corner just inside of the doors. Not very practical by any means. Room: Were booked into a Management Suite (630) at first. Lovely sized room with a balcony, but unfortunately dark and just overlooking the roof of Facil, one of the restaurants. We then voluntarily downgraded to a City Studio (1021) which with it´s 40sqm is still a perfectly adequately sized room, but with a fab city view to boot. The room itself is nothing extravagant, but very functional. Bed is on the firm side and the pillows rather depressing (read de-flated). But if you ask they will bring you more and better pillows! Please not that the A/C doesn´t work in wintertime so we spent our first night in a room that resembled a sauna more than a hotelroom. We were of course fiddling with the controls, when we apparently should have adjusted the radiator... The room is still on the warm side, but the windows do open if you need further cool air. There was a smell of bad drain in the room that housekeeping claimed to not being able to do something about. Were offered to change rooms, but could not be bothered once again. Storage is sufficent. Staff: Very correct and pleasant enough. Very helpful once approached Service: Nothing to remark Food: The breakfast room in Facil is recommendable! Lovely, elegant and very relaxed atmosphere. Not a huge selection by any means (unless you´re into juice), but a very high standard of the items offered. Liked it a lot! Tried Private Dining one night and was presented the quite possibly least flavourful Caesar salad with chicken i have ever eaten. Service was quick and courteous though. Things to do: Don´t miss a visit to the Reichstag! They also have an excellent restaurant open for dinner. Please do doublecheck if the security is as rigorous as when we were there before going. If yes, then you do need to make a reservation, bring passports and undergo quite a securitycheck before entering. Also the museum island is fantastic! But beware if you try to go on a Monday as a lot of the museums are closed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mandinkadell
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Mandala Hotel and Suites (September 28-October 1 2010) during our trip to Berlin and highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Berlin. The hotel lobby is gorgeous...it reminded me of a winter wonderland...very pretty. The rooms are huge!!! The room we stayed in did seem a tiny bit outdated just based on colors and countertop materials, etc., but it still was lovely!!! We stayed on the 8th floor and there was a washer and dryer free to use (not sure if all floors have one???). We were running late for a tour one morning so we embarrassingly asked if someone from housekeeping could grab our stuff out of the dryer when it was done and they did it without hesitation or complaint!!! The hotel staff was all very helpful, friendly, and nice. We ate breakfast and dinner here once...the breakfast was just average, but the dinner was DELICIOUS!!! Also, we had a very difficult time finding our favorite drinks in Germany...Grey Goose Vodka and Captain Morgan Rum and their bar had both for us (they had to go look in the back for the Captain....LOL)!!! It is located directly across the street from the Sony Center and is about 1 block to the Potsdamer Platz train station. Anywhere we wanted to go in the city we were able to just walk out the door and get right on the train and be there in 10-15 minutes. The Sony Center also has enough to do if you find yourself without any plans for a couple of hours...it has bars, restaurants, movies, history, etc. Also, there is a cute little Australian bar down the street directly to the left of the hotel...forgot the name, but very friendly patrons and workers!!! Our only complaints were that we had no idea that breakfast was included in our stay...hence we only ate their once. It would have been nice to have known that before we checked out so we didn't search for breakfast around the city a couple of times. Also, upon our arrival we asked the guy that checked us in where we could go for a casual restaurant and he sent us a few blocks away. We discovered the inside of the Sony Center on our last day and discovered that it had TONS of casual restaurants in it...why didn't he suggest that to us??? Overall, I would highly suggest this hotel to any Berlin tourists!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent short stay - amazingly quiet, given that it's in Potsdamer Platz”
Reviews.Author: ricepudding21
Reviews.Content: I agree with most reviewers - this was a real pleasure. I wondered when I arrived - the reception seems squeezed into the side of a building right on a very busy street - from similar receptions in places like Paris and New York I expected a small and claustrophobic room, dark interiors etc. but in Berlin - what a delight! A huge suite overlooking a delightful interior garden of bamboo. Absolutely silent - and almost as big as my London flat, for about £200 a night. I know Berlin is spoiled for good hotels, but this was a very pleasant surprise. Potsdamer Platz very centrally located, subway is only yards away and it's a short hop to Reichstag, Unter den Linden etc. etc. I am tempted not to bother staying anywhere else when I'm in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location -- Well Serviced, Clean Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: marena23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Mandala in August and it was easy to find arriving at Berlin Schoenefeld and taking the subway to the hotel. Upon checking in we were pleased to find that we received a room upgrade from the Management Suite to an Executive Suite with two terraces. The room was absolutely perfect, it included a well provisioned kitchenette and the tap water in Berlin was amazing. The location was excellent also, a short walk to the Brandenburg Gate as well as the other major attractions. The hotel bar was great and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The cocktails were a hit and the food was top notch. They even offered an umbrella to go out seeing as it was raining one of the nights we were there. The area around the hotel was nice also, a great restaurant right around the corner (I forgot the name) and the mall close by had all the shops you could require need for general shopping or traveling necesities. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel to any couple/family looking for a reasonably priced getaway to Berline which is central enough to see all the sights Berlin has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Nickolai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for my 30th birthday with my partner. We arrived at the hotel about 8pm. Once arriving at reception we were told that there were no "management suites" available so they upgraded us to an "executive superior"! And wow. Its like an open planned spacious flat! Great views across the city from the 8th floor panoramic window. Very very quiet inside. No noise from the street could be heard even though it was bustling. The next day (on my birthday) when we were getting ready there was a ring on the door and a member of reception staff was standing there with a bottle of chilled bubbly in a bucket and said "on behalf of the hotel we would like you to have this. happy birthday." What a lovely touch. The staff were so helpful with other things, such as direction, recommendations for food and other attractions. On our last night i tipped the helpful receptionist (the one who presented the champers) with a 10€ tip. He said "there's no need sir. Its my job". I said "you have helped us endlessly during our stay. We want to say thank you". He said "we need more people like you in this hotel". This was probably a sad stark reality that this sort of top notch hotel attracts (on the whole) clientele that treat the staff with little respect - because they are better than them. I'm not saying everyone at the hotel is like this, but staff seemed genuinely humbled when ever we even smiled and talked to them. Just our impression from 2 grounded people that just got a cracking deal on this hotel. End of the day these members of staff are working their backsides off to earn a living like everyone else. The only negative is the price of breakfast, but it was the same price as room service so we did that. It was excellently presented and very tasty. The spa was brilliant. Again, one negative was that i had booked a massage and when I went to turn up for it they had actually not typed the booking into the system. Then there was more confusion about the treatment i would get so i didnt bother in the end, All in all a fantastic 5-star experience for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Posh Accommodations in the Heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Beaurex212
Reviews.Content: After hours of sightseeing and braving the elements of an early winter in Berlin, nothing was more enjoyable to my friends and I than cocktail hour at The Mandala before heading out again to enjoy the city by night. We had a beautifully appointed room with a terrace on the 10th floor; not only did we have soft, plush beds, but an in-room sound system that piped the hotel's various compilation CDs throughout the space. Service was terrific -- front desk gave us detailed recommendations on boat tours and helped us navigate purchase of Berlin Welcome passes. Again, cocktail hour at the hotel bar is not to be missed and daily breakfast at the hotel restaurant is also worth doing (tho it's 27 euros a person, not sure it should be an everyday affair if you're in town for more than a few days).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with wonderful service !”
Reviews.Author: Cierco
Reviews.Content: Well, finally after being in Munich and treated like a dog in other hotel, we got an exceptional apartment in this wonderful hotel ! Our room was 1006, an executive suite. This is quite large and very well designed. They gave us, as a cortesy, one bottle of sparkling wine in our first night. The service was excellent. We were greeted by mr.Demba Sabally and mrs.Myriam ( or Miriam ) They were excellent. The lay-out of the apartment consists in a big room with full kitchen ( without a microwave ) and a good desk and chair to connect to internet ( 30 euros for 7 days, not expensive and with high speed ) and a big bed, alongside to the bathroom with a shower separated from the tube ! There is a parking lot in the hotel and the price is 20 euros a day. ( not expensive and they bring your car almost instantly ) We did not went to breakfast, as we had a kitchen in the apt. ( but the price is high, 27 euros per person ! ) Everything went fine. The city is beautiful and we definitely had an excellent good time there ! We are going to retorn as soon as possible ! Thanks !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location, reception staff need to be a bit more welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: connell66
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mandala Hotel for the weekend with husband and another couple. Our rooms were lovely. We had the cheapest room and it was very spacious and modern with tea and coffee making facilities as well as a small hob and fridge. The bathroom was large and spotlessly clean. Beds extremely comfortable. We stayed overlooking main road, but the double glazing was so good that you did not hear a thing. My one criticism was that there was no proper doorman and it is supposed to be a 5 star hotel, so that when we arrived there was no-one to greet us at the entrance or take our luggage. When I asked the girl on reception to send someone out, she said she would, but nothing actually happened. They could not seem to rustle up any English tea bags for the kettle in our room, which I found absolutely incredible, after all it isn't such a strange request. Our friends however needed more hangers and they were found and delivered very quickly. I know this is nit picking, but in a 5 star hotel I think they should at least have a doorman. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel because they wanted 27euros each for a buffet breakfast and no-one seemed to know what the price would be if we just wanted cereal! Apart from these small niggles, we found the hotel very satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice for staying in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: S_von_Linde
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a design hotel, and it is worth it. They have large suits which are very tastily (in my case minimalistic) designed and they are located very near to the next subway station at Potsdammer Platz. The price is dependent on the time of booking. We paid around 140 Euros per night, though most of the times the prices are higher. The breakfast is worth to pay extra: an exquisite selection of things to eat, countless fresh juice and everything you like prepared by the kitchen. The only con is has been an unfriendly guy at the reception desk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mattski46
Reviews.Content: The Mandala would be the best all round hotel stay I've had in Germany. The rooms are modern and contemporary, beautifully clean and well appointed. Don't go out until you'vre eaten as the food in both the bar and restaraunt is superb and reasonably priced. World class!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with the big rooms”
Reviews.Author: EPWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location and great reviews here. We were not disappointed. The room was the largest we've ever stayed at while traveling in Europe. The walk-in closet itself was the size of the hotel rooms we sometimes stayed at. Everything was spotlessly clean, the bathroom was spacious and well-stocked. Loved the little kitchenette area. The buffet breakfast was expensive, but the quality of food and the selection was well worth it. We also enjoyed drinks at the bar. The only thing that I disliked is the spa. The prices were outrageous, but the quality of services delivered was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Ilyaros
Reviews.Content: we were upgraded from a studio to a management suite, which had a lot of space: huge bathroom, walk in dressing closet, a small kitchenette (you can order cooking appliances if you wish to cook your meal), a balcony... the deal was bed only and as the breakfast at the hotel is very expensive we did not had trouble to find a place just opposite at the Sony center (i would recommend ALEX which opens early and has a very good buffet breakfast for a very reasonable price). we did not use other hotel services so can't say anything on that but a general impression is that the stuff is very attentive. we had some extras charged to our room at check out (such as solarium, which we did not used) - we were politely asked if we used that and the charge was dropped when we said we did not. the most important feature is the LOCATION - actually walking distance from major attractions and major transport intersection: S bahn, U bahn, bus lines - you name it - all just beside the hotel (200 bus line just in front) - very convenient to go anywhere. the city is large and transport is important. and last but not least: a lot of cafes, restaurants and shops just behind the hotel in a new and lively Potsdammer platz area. first class hotel in a first class city

Reviews.Title: “best in berlin”
Reviews.Author: lovestapas
Reviews.Content: just back from the mandala and had a great stay , the location was perfect just minutes from all the major attractions . when we arrived at the hotel at 10 30am we thought we would have to wait till the 2 30 pm checkin time but we were in our room by 10 45 am . the room was huge and had everything you would expect from a 5 star,flat screen tv , great sound system , kitchenette and massive bathroom . But the best thing about the mandala is the staff they were just brillant especially Daniel in the Qui bar . So if you are looking for a great hotel in berlin you wont get better than the Mandala

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary Service - not enough stars describe it”
Reviews.Author: gocomoso
Reviews.Content: Service, Service, Service - attentive, friendly, courteous, prompt, better than efficient. We would rate the service better than 5 star. In traveling all over the world for almost 30 years, we've never experienced service of this quality. All the staff always greeted us personally, including knowing our names, and could not do enough to help us. We had 2 corner suites - expansive area, large bathrooms, kitchen, living room, queen bed, great view of the Sony Center across the street. Very close to S-Bahn stop, restaurants, shops, cinemas. Wireless internet in the room kept dropping off and thus had to use the ethernet cable. Free internet would be desirable. Definitely will stay here again. Our thanks to the staff of The Mandala for a wonderful stay

Reviews.Title: “This may be a great option if you're not fussy”
Reviews.Author: Max2502
Reviews.Content: The Mandala apparently is a 5 star hotel - I'm not so sure how they hand out these ratings but I think whoever is responsible might want to tighten their standards. This may be the best 4 star hotel but let me tell you why it is lacking that little extra flair: 1. There is no lobby area. The entrance is so constricted that when 4 members of staff are there simultaneously, it feels positively crowded. Contrast this to the Ritz Carlton across the road - now there's a grand lobby area. 2. There is no business centre. The pokey corner they use to set up a laptop which can only be used standing up doesn't count. 3. There is no pool. In summer. Enough said. 4. Staff are efficient (4 star) but not extraordinary (5 star). Contrast this with the Adlon where extraordinary is made to seem normal. 5. On check in staff failed to ask for my choice of newspaper, failed to mention special features such as the bread roll service or ironing/laundry room. I callled to confirm my preferred paper. It failed to arrive 2 out of 3 mornings. 6. The rooms allow for a degree of self-catering and of course room service. Although they are big enough, there is nowhere to eat nor is the room service provided on trolleys which double up as tables, like any good 5 star establishment would do. 7. The hotel is 11 years old and the hallway carpets look and smell every bit as old. Memo to management - rip up that ugly carpet immediately. 8. The Grundig TV, a true boxy (30 cm) looks like it belongs in a museum. If you enjoy unwinding in fron tof a TV, you'll be sorely disappointed. A flat screen TV would do this place a world of good. 9. In the room, only 1 set of small white wine glasses are provided - for water, beer, wine - whatever you plan to drink. Contrast this to the Adlon where no fewer than 4 different types of top qulaity galsses are provided. 10. Need an extra bed? Don't bother - the main bed is great but the extra bd has a mattress so thin and uncomfortable as to be utterly useless. On the positive side: 1. Excellent location with easy access to train stations and many attractions. 2. Very spacious rooms. 3. The aforementioned laudry room with steam iron. 4. Er..good location - oops, I'm repeating myself so that must be it. Bottom line - unless you get a rate that is at least 30% lower than the Grand Hyatt, Adlon Kempinski or the Ritz Carlton, you are better off at any one of those fine establishments.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL.”
Reviews.Author: MARGIEHICKS
Reviews.Content: The staff were excellent and the rooms were spacious and well appointed, There is a musical instrument museum nearby that is well worth a visit, and the Berlin Philharmonic concert was just across the road. Have a massage at their health centre as it was the best I've ever had and go for a foot massage walk around the roof area.

Reviews.Title: “Stylishly minimalist boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Limehouse_Lil
Reviews.Content: Excellent Potsdamer Platz location between Sony Centre and Arkadie shopping mall. Larger rooms are very comfortable and spacious. Beds and bedding very comfortable. Restaurant has a high reputation so is expensive, but bar food and room service reasonable and delicious. Rooms also equipped for self-catering. Great for business use (including conference facilities) but also friendly and helpful enough for leisure trips. Pleasant bar with chillout music.

Reviews.Title: “A calm, relaxing oasis perfectly located in Berlin, with walking distance to all must-see attractions”
Reviews.Author: Love_Life_Adventure
Reviews.Content: The Mandala Hotel is located only 5 minutes walk from the Brandenburger Tor. The metro station Potsdamer Platz is only 1 minute walk from the hotel entrance. In the front of the hotel, on the other side of the street, is the Sony Center, with IMAX cinema etc, and behind the hotel, there is this big shopping mall, and a small street (without cars) with a lot of nice restaurants, bars, lounges etc. But, as I said, it takes only 5-7 minutes to walk to Brandenburger Tor, Tiergarten (a big beautiful park, like central Park in New York) and the majestic Bundestag-building. From Brandenburger Tor, you can go down the main street - Unter den Linden - with a lot of boutiqes, restaurants and life. And when you have reached the end of Unter den Linden, you are near Alexanderplatz and Berliner Dom and a lot of other exciting places to see. So, the Mandala Hotel is very centrally located. But the best part, is that - in a busy city like Berlin - you can walk into the mandala hotel and just fell the relaxing and calming atmosphere the moment you wealk in the doors. We were met by very service minded staff, which offered us some warm refreshment towels when we checked in. We arrived a couple of hours before check-in time, but we got our room, and a very nice gentleman from the staff helped us up tp our room. The room is really an apartment - a suite!! We had a normal standard room, yet it was huge! And beautifully furnished with delicat interiors. And with a balcony. A very nice bed, with excellent madrasses, a big bathroom with a tub and lot of space. it also had a sofa and chairs, and tv and stereo - with a seleciton of cd's. The room also had a fully equiped kitchen, and a walk-in closet. I would say this is GREAT value for money. At the top floor of the hotel there is a spa. Here you can go relax after a long day out sightseeing. They have this "foot-therapy"-thing on the roof, that is a great, romatic experience to do with your partner, I would recommend to do it after it is dark. This is a "pathway" a small way that goes around the building on the roof, with marvellous view over Berlin skyline. Here, you should walk on stones lays down in different shapes and patterns to relaxe and heal tired feet, and it helps! Definately a nice thing to do. The breakfast is also GREAT. Very delicate, good selection of different fruit, vegetables, meat, cheese, jam, etc - all you can axpect in a luxury hotel. They also had something like 10 different fresh juices - I would reccomend the fresh apple-juice:) Eggs and omelets can be ordered directly from your table. We would highly recommend this hotel, for its relaxing and freindly atmosphere, for the great value for money and for the good location in Berlin. PS - one evening we bought tickets for a consert with the Belin Chamber Orchestra in the Berliner Dom - wonderfull! If you get a chance to do this - go for it!! Great sound with brilliant achustic and a wonderfull church. Don't pay to go in there during the day, it is better to pay for a consert - and see the curch at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Serene elegance...”
Reviews.Author: Marek66
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend to celebrate an anniversary, so was looking for something a bit special. The Mandala didn't disappoint. Well placed at the heart of the trendy new Potsdamer Platz area of Berlin, the hotel is easily accessed by public transport, being only a few yards from U and S Bahn stations. Reception is super-efficient and polite, as are all the staff in the hotel, from the bottom up. The basic rooms (more like min-suites) are huge and beautifully appointed – vast bathroom and walk-in closet were great. A tiny kitchen is also provided, with hob and kettle and mini-bar/fridge – only the lack of a mini-bar tariff caused confusion. The bed was a king-size – supremely comfortable, with high-quality bed-linen. Breakfast was another delightful experience, with a vast choice of quality foods, fruits, cereals and fresh juices. Individual orders for your choice of egg dishes were taken and delivered in perfect time. The ambience of the breakfast room was very pleasant too, and you were never hurried. Weekend breakfast times are extended to 12noon - which is great for those who enjoy a lazy morning. I used the gym on the top floor a couple of times (free to residents) and it was well equipped and spotless. My only minor quibbles would be, that in a 5-star hotel today, I do not expect to have to pay for internet access – it's rather like having to pay for hot water or TV! It's made all the worse when you walk past 2-star motels and back-packer hostels, all offering free internet access. They also need to update their TV and audio systems – both worked well in our room, but looked rather out of place in the slick modern surroundings. A nice flat-screen TV and an iPod/iPhone dock would have been a better solution.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall Experience”
Reviews.Author: Unwilted
Reviews.Content: We had a good overall experience. A few details. The wifi is not free in the rooms, as others have mentioned. It was 10 Euro per 24 hour period, or 30 Euro for seven days. Parking is in a garage below the hotel and is not discounted (20 Euro per night). We brought a small dog with no prior mention of a fee and found out at check out that dogs cost 35 Euro per night -- a bit excessive. The breakfast was included for us and was easily the fanciest breakfast we've had. Not sure I'd pay for it again, but it was a good experience. We didn't try the restaurant otherwise or the bar or spa. We did use the fitness room which is with the spa. It is adequate. A few strength machines and some cardio equipment. Not sure why, but the staff kept coming in to look and then leaving. The cleaning crew came through and cleaned very late in the day, and the button for "do not disturb" seemed not to work right. This is just one of a handful of very minor details that are not significant, but that together make this hotel slightly imperfect. Still excellent though, and we'd be excited to stay there again if the price were right.

Reviews.Title: “All round excellent experience here”
Reviews.Author: Bbi
Reviews.Content: We had two "management suites" - they were clean, comfortable (great bed) and quiet. The room and the bathroom were quite spacious. I picked the suite (really a large room) because it had a king bed . I avoided the garden rooms on the ground floor - it seemed to me that would be noisy. Really wonderful location - I agree with the other location comments, and add only (as others have) that not only are you near everything, but the Potsdammer Platz area itself has a lot more than first meets the eye. It may look like there's a Sony office tower across from the hotel, but if you venture in to the left of it you will find that it is only a part of a stunning covered courtyard with lots of people and restaurants. We did not get breakfast included but went next door to a perfectly fine coffee shop place, and there are other places too. The hotel has a fairly extensive buffet, but unless you're a big eater you won't begin to get your money's worth - I think it was $25 a person. The multiple guest laundry rooms were clean, free, well-equipped (even with free detergent) and even had a TV - for this reason alone I would stay there again. The kitchen in the suite did not have a microwave, and seemed not be be well equipped BUT when I read the room directory at the end of the stay, I discovered that a microwave or any other kitchen equipment were available on request. For me this would have taken care of breakfast, but I found out too late. The only negative is that free internet was limited to the reception floor and the 5th floor which was inconvenient. Internet in the room was not free. There may be a principle behind all this though - hotel literature talked about how guests were free from electromagnetic waves in their rooms. Finally, the reception staff was extraordinarily friendly, helpful and professional. (Didn't try the spa - can't comment)

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location if you can afford it”
Reviews.Author: notacouchpotato
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Executive Suite at the Mandala and (mostly) had a great time. My reservation refers to the fact that we had to change rooms and were given a slightly smaller and less well arranged room than the fabulous one we occupied originally. the location is perfect - right opposite the Potsdamer Plaza, next to a U and S Bahn and a bus stop, and within walking distance of many of the major sights. Fairly nice goodies in the bathroom (though I do hate liquid soap) as well as robes and slippers. There is also a spa though we were too busy sightseeing to utilise it. The restaurant - a Michelin starred one - provided us with probably one of the best meals I have eaten in my life - and definitely the most expensive. A pocket stretching treat but a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Still remember how great it was”
Reviews.Author: Rebus9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four years ago and I've been in many hotels around the world since, but my wife and I still recall it as one of the most elegant hotels we've stayed in. Location is excellent, room is marvelous, and rates were reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel on an excelent location”
Reviews.Author: Mshirit
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for our short honeymoon on January. The city was frozen so we got to spend a lot of time in the hotel and our choice of the hotel couldn't be better! We stayed at the management suite. The suite was huge (50 square meters). When comparing to other hotels suite on the same price, this is the largest room available (others were 33 Square meters for the same price...). The suite had a very large bathroom and separate area for a living room. Also a kitchenette and dressing room... The design is very modern and still warm. We enjoyed our stay and recommend it to everyone. You can take a look at the photos I took there

Reviews.Title: “Best Berlin Platz”
Reviews.Author: jo1970Singapore
Reviews.Content: The Mandala deserves the rave reviews it receives here and I'd like to commend the staff for their care, efficiency and excellent service. The hotel in on Potsdamer Platz with a small alcove which helps in unloading the car. Friendly, efficient check in that clarified there would be a 30 Euro charge per night for the dog which had already been explained on booking. Rate included breakfast and use of spa facilities. The rates are very good for the service and quality of the hotel. If you wish to stay with a dog, then only the Executive Suite is an option. And what a great option it is. Very large 60 sqm studio with seperate lounge/eating are and small kitchenette. King bed which was a tad too firm and soft pillows. I guess the only real gripe i had was that the pillows were too soft - so clearly there were not many issues during our stay! Good breakfasts and you need only ask for eggs although there is no menu as such. Good selection of fresh juices, fruits and other European breakfast goodies. Valet parking was good. Reasonable rate and we either walked or took cheap taxis during the stay as you are so close to everything. Ka De We is within 10 minutes and you should go and have a seafood lunch there as the quality is first rate (plus a nice glass of bubbles to help the meal along). Good room service and funky bar. Mini bar rates are also very reasonable. Some other pluses, free laundry room on 3 floors and a good gym. All in all, an excellent choice and hopefully we shall be back for another long weekend soon ;)

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly Terrific Suite and Service, Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaJoe
Reviews.Content: After a little trouble finding the place in my rental car at 10 pm on Thursday night, I was shocked by the friendliness of the staff. I had called the front desk because the navigational system told me I had arrived but I couldn't see the entrance, so the front desk person came running down the sidewalk to find and guide me, unloaded (despite my obscene volumes of luggage), then valet-parked my rental car. I was really tired, but the staff were extremely friendly, helpful, upbeat, succeeded in getting me to laugh and smile and cheer up after a nasty 700 Km drive... The best was yet to come: the room. To be honest, I'd never seen a room quite like this one, bedroom, living room / study, kitchen / dining room, two bathrooms, entrance hallway, wrap-around balcony including nice views of their rooftop bamboo garden, the whole thing in extremely tasteful blond wood tones.... I feel like I'm writing for an architectural magazine, but it's true. I paid about EUR 250 for the room (may be expensive if you're on a personal vacation), but right in the center of sold-out (owing to a convention) Berlin and desperate for a hotel room on a business trip, it really was a bargain, 1/3 the price being charged by similar class hotels at the time. Business services I need all worked flawlessly: unloading and valet-parking the car, efficient checkin/checkout, wakeup call, room service breakfast, internet access, send/receive faxes, printing e-mails and document attachments and then sending them up to my room, it was great. Personally, I'd seriously consider staying here on a family vacation as well, though, because the room had so much space, at least 4 separate rooms, a full kitchen with stove, large eating-alcove with table for 4, refrigerator. The only possible drawback was that the bar was tiny, no pool, cramped common areas, but personally I ate room service breakfast to save time and spent all my time in the room, either sleeping or working against a deadline. Location also is not ideal I think as it's in an extremely modern, sterile, new-construction development on the Alexanderplatz, but I guess you can't have it all and it's an EUR 5 cab ride from the Unter den Linden. All in all, I spend about 3 months a year living in hotels and have becomem pretty picky and I'd really give this one a huge thumbs up: great price / value proposition for the room, and very friendly and efficient staff. Stay here and avoid the over-priced chains!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely!”
Reviews.Author: smeeshu
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place! My husband and I arrived around 6am after a long, overnight train ride. We were so happy to hear that our room was ready because we desperately needed a rest! The executive suite was huge. Plenty of room to spread out and relax and the bathroom was just superb! I especially loved the deep tub and towel warmer. Sleeping here is easy, as the windows block out all of the street noise - even the minor construction happening across the street from our side of the building. My only complaint is that we would have liked to have our room a little cooler than 20 deg C (it felt warmer), but were unable to drop the thermostat lower. We enjoyed the spa on the top floor every afternoon when we returned from sight seeing. Having a sauna and using the foot reflexology path, followed by naps in the super comfortable loungers with beautiful floor to ceiling views of the city was the perfect way to relax before dinner. One thing we were very surprised with was the quality of the food in the lounge. We had big plans to explore the city and try lots of different restaurants, but we ended up eating dinner at the hotel lounge twice because it was so good. I believe they share a kitchen with the restaurant on the 5th floor, Facil. The first night we had the truffle spaghetti and asparagus soup. It was one of the best pasta dishes I have ever had. Fresh spaghetti and a truffle cream sauce that wasn't too heavy with cream or heady with truffles. Perfect! The soup was served with smoked salmon and was out of this world. The second night we had the nicoise salad and the gnocci and were equally impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend”
Reviews.Author: Kreutzburger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days. The room are big and delicate, the breakfast perfect, the staff very very nice and Service minded. We see no reason to try a new hotel for our next Berlin trip.

Reviews.Title: “First class, every time”
Reviews.Author: Zooks2000
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Mandala a number of times, and have loved it every time. Wonderfully attentive staff, beautiful suites, with lots of attention to detail, from the minibar, to the CD's provided for entertainment. I brought my 1yr old son on one trip last year, and along with the cot they provided him with his own dressing gown, wash bag and slippers. A perfect location to get to wherever you want to go, tourist areas, business, U-bahn, shopping, eating, cinema, it's all there. A VERY classy affair.

Reviews.Title: “Some minor hiccups but overall a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jvgf
Reviews.Content: Funny how different experiences for the same weekend at the same hotel can be. Easter in Berlin on arrival we were shown a studio room even though I had booked an executive suite. This was rectified within 10 minutes. When we arrived there the double bed had only been made with one single duvet and two tiny decorative pillows and we had to call three times to get a second duvet and more pillows. The rooms are huge comfortable but not as designy as i had hoped but that's a matter of taste. Everything else about the hotel thereafter was brilliant. Excellent service, brilliant location and a wonderful breakfast with a huge selection of stuff from the buffet and eggs cooked to order everyday. The spa area while not huge is very relaxing and boasts some of the best views of Berlin. Would defintiely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, fantastic hotel, superb service from all staff”
Reviews.Author: travelprincess27
Reviews.Content: Highly rate this hotel - from minute you walk through door you start feeling very spoilt. Superb room, excellent service from Reservation staff, reception staff, all staff in breakfast restaurant who completely spoil you with attention - special thanks to the increadibly pleasant gentleman who makes sure you are not kept waiting long for a table at breakfast - and all handled with a fabulous smile. Superb bar with high level of service and great cocktails offered. Unfortunately did not have time to use Spa - so cannot comment. Thank you to all.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mutleygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Mandala Berlin for 5 nights and loved it. The hotel is very well situated at Potsdamer Platz and is across the road from the Sony Centre, so it was convenient for bars, restaurants and shops as well as public transport. It is also close enough to walk to many of the attractions of this vibrant city. The hotel is very smart and stylish and our room on the 10th floor was very spacious with a large comfortable bed, walk in dressing area and beautiful bathroom. There was also a good desk if you are there on business We had an excellent view of the modern Sony Centre, but there was no traffic noise to disturb our sleep. It was definitely in the luxury class. The hotel restaurant is Michelin starred. The staff were all brilliant and spoke good English. They were helpful, polite and efficient at all times. The breakfast is expensive if it is not included in your booking, but if you shop around you can find an inclusive deal. It did make the perfect start to the day as there was everything there you could want, including a large selection of fresh juices. I highly recommend this beautiful hotel - we could find no fault in it whatsoever and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Boutique”
Reviews.Author: Farnham_Flyer
Reviews.Content: This is clearly a quality establishment and the stay was most enjoyable. Plus points were - the light and fresh style, as many "boutique" places are rather dark and dingy; superior size, fit and finish. Also a great location - not just for business (it's right in the heart of the modern district), but also for getting around as a tourist. Right by the Potsdamer Platz transport hub. Very calm, quiet feel about it. The only niggles were - lack of flexibility on sleeping accommodation - only 1 bed per room (though a huge one, so not a problem for us - but seem people may want to be aware of this); the "Japanese" style bathroom had a fiddly shower and wasn't sound proofed (again not a real problem for us - just something to be aware of). Biggest irritation was the lack of room temperature control which led to the poor sleep quality score. There was an independent control but the staff confirmed it had been switched off.... The room got stuffy as a result which lead to having to open a window which wasn't ideal due to traffic noise. Otherwise - didn't eat there (believe there is an excellent restaurant) or use the spa (again seems to be highly recommended). Did however, use the bar - stylish and relaxing area with an excellent drink menu. Some niggles, but would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for (and even a laundry room!)”
Reviews.Author: GregLA
