Reviews.Content: The Mandala Hotel was a great place to stay. It is expensive but you get what you pay for. Part of my visit to Berlin was for business and part was for sightseeing. My wife and I brought our 9 month old boy and the Mandala couldn't have been more accommodating. The suite was the perfect amount of space for the three of us (although it would have been nice to have a door on the bedroom so we could put the baby to bed and not whisper until he fell asleep.) They have laundry rooms on each floor which were a great help during our stay and they even had a babysitting service that we used for two evenings. The location is average but it is close to the U-Bahn and the S-Bahn so it isn't hard to get around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very good convenient design hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkB55
Reviews.Content: Most design hotels offer a shoebox sized room. The Mandala is different. A decent size room and bathroom with kithchenette, CDplayer and good choice of TV. Decor is simple but the bed was very comfortable. Convenient for Potsdamer Platz stations. The service was really excellent, always polite and helpful. The breakfast buffet in the dining room gave a great choice. This has to be one of the best hotel stays on a business trip anywhere in Europe. The fitness facility was as ever underutilised but very adequate. The spa looks stylish but I did not use it.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: geeketchic
Reviews.Content: While the location of Potsdamer place seems an unlikely location to find such a gem, the mandala hotel have managed to create a stylish, sexy yet serene setting. The rooms are well-designed in a minimalist/understated manner, are comforting, cozy and extremely relaxing. The lounge/bar is pure sophisticated urban style. The spa is nothing short of superb and the staff friendly and accomodating. This hotel is heaven.

Reviews.Title: “I am lost as a customer for any other hotel in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: Thunderstone
Reviews.Content: 'The Mandala' provides the most remarkeble combination of perfect location, magical interior design, excellent and heartwarmingly friendly service (they even got my high heels fixed in no time on a weekend!), phantastic restaurant and fairytale Spa-relaxation to a very fair price!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, quiet, hotel with a great location and service-oriented staff”
Reviews.Author: YS_2009
Reviews.Content: We've spent our 4-day vacation in Berlin, staying at the Mandala hotel. The hotel is beautifully designed, very quiet & elegant. The rooms are comfortable, the bath luxurious and the staff is willing to help. It is located next to the Arkaden, and across the street from the Sony center.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, fantastic, fantastic”
Reviews.Author: KristinaRiga
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel as a part of our engagemetn selebration. We have stayed in the suit on the 11th floor and used the end of the week spessial package (that has included coctails and massage). The hotel was just fantastic with excellent staff, excellent interrior. Th ebreakfast was beyond any comments...just the best. The hotel has got spall spa centre on the 11th floor as well that could be used for those who stayed in suits. It was excellent experience with small details that made the impression. Firs, we were alone in the spa (no staff that may disturb you), there were grean apples and tea available. I wish I will have an opportunity to visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sheraz1
Reviews.Content: Not obvious from the outside but the hotel is very nicely designed inside. The service in this hotel was very good. We cannot comment on the food as we tended to eat out all the time. It is well located with Postdamer Platz across the street, which is great for food or a sit down after a hard day's sightseeing. All major attractions were within walking distance of this centrally located hotel. The hotel is very nicely designed. Although the foyer is not as grand as other 5* hotels. Our room, however was very nice (Garden Studio) with a walk in closet ,separate office area (not that we needed one), kitchenette, garden view and sliding doors through to the bathroom area. Lots of space. Berlin is a stunning city with lots to see and do (other than the obvious attractions). I would also recommend the Trabi Safari, which is located near the Balloon Garten. Great fun driving the old Trabent's around Berlin!! I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BurritoDude
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Berlin and I could not have stayed at a better hotel than the Mandala. The decor is trendy minimalist and done in neutral colors. The rooms are modern and really big (the wrap around desk with desktop sockets and walk-in closet were totally unexpected and wonderful). The staff has an amazing sense of customer service and made all sorts of reservations for us without batting an eye. The location is very central and right next to a major metro stop. I would highly recommend the Mandala to business travelers or couples (it might not be appropriate for kids given the serene nature of the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: SJSLondon
Reviews.Content: Huge rooms - tons of space; friendly staff who are very eager to please; unbeatable location with access to everything interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Boutique”
Reviews.Author: LorLev
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located to everything but the high street, but with so much to see in Berlin, we managed to walk nearly everywhere from Potsdamer Platz. The rooms are huge- suites actually, with an office that we nearly missed completely (and never used). The staff was kind and helpful and the breakfast (and the room in which it is served) was delightful. The spa is beautiful but I must say I had one of the most underwhelming massages of my life. Not bad per se, but certainly nothing special. I would not recommend having a massage at the Mandala. We liked the streamlined decoration found throughout the hotel and would definitely recommend it. I would have appreciated a better entertainment package though- some movies on demand or satellite channels would have been great in dealing with jet lag.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: MacGreen
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel is definitely 5 star. On entrance to the hotel we were greeted with a refreshing cold towel, particularly welcomed since Berlin was experiencing a warm spell. We were here to celebrate my birthday, and my husband tells me that they could not have been more accommodating with regards to arranging a surprise birthday cake at breakfast. The breakfast was excellent as well - with a wide ranging buffet. If you want to experience a hotel where you won't be disappointed with any aspect - this is the one to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service, nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: BaluPrague
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located in the city - close to Potsdamer Platz with fast access to public transportation, cinemas, shopping mall etc. The service in the hotel is excellent! And we were also excited about the breakfast buffet. I enjoyed the Fitness Centre and the spa area with the Sauna. The only small negativ point - the bathroom did not really meet my expectation. When taking a shower the floor got wet

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mimsw
Reviews.Content: What a great location in the heart of the modern Berlin at Potsdamer Plaz. There are sophisticated shopping arcades and top restaurants right outside the door, as well as other prestigious hotels and facilities. The rooms are surprisingly spacious, simple, yet clean and highly functional design...they have a real sense of serenity and are welcome at the end of a busy work day. The only notable issue was that the suites lack contemporary equipment, such as flat panel tv's, which are now standard even in lesser properties. Overall, there is so much value here, especially in such a preferred location! The reception staff was exceptionally helpful to me with several personal travel challenges, including finding me a suitable mobile phone solution. Room service was always prompt and friendly. They have a very high end restaurant in the property (FACIL), which I think needs further thinking in order to better accomodate the broader needs of hotel clientele. Also, this property could also use a seasoned concierge, one well connected with top restaurants, though it's hard to beat the real The managing partner was fantastic in dealing with one issue I had at the restaurant, and, after experiencing his sincere effort to make sure things were right, I wouldn't hesitate to return to the Mandala.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - shame about breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Lndn
Reviews.Content: if you looking for something a bit different from the Marriot or Intercontinental this hotel certainly fits the bill. The lobby is small, but the rooms are massive, they have desks, walk in wardrobe and a large bathroom, they also have CDs and magazines in the rooms which is a nice touch. The bed is comfy with no problems. The only problem I found was with the breakfast, it cost €25, which unless your not paying the bill, is not worth it at all. there is little an international traveler will like, lots of meats but other than muesli they have no cereals or other non continental food. if you want a much nicer breakfast stay at the Ritz Carlton across the Platz, its €10 cheaper per night and the breakfast is incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible staff, cheap and tacky”
Reviews.Author: rivernew
Reviews.Content: This is a cold and uncomfortable ugy hotel. the staff are incredibly rude and unwelcoming, and unhelpful. would never stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Berlin with a small touch of design”
Reviews.Author: portfolio
Reviews.Content: NIice Hotel. HELFULL STAFF. Small lobby.. Some problems with the room, we booked for to persons ans when we arrived the room was only prepared for one. Some days we dint have bath amenities we had to ask. They say the offer nwes papers you like but only a very short list, We ooked from Designhotels.com , using the promotion os the designshotels club, that included breakfast. The room had a nice balcony with view for Postdam platz, and spacios, but old design. Breackfast was explendid but, desorganized, once we had to go up and waited for almost an our to have a table. The worst was, when we chekout and they charged us the breackfast extra, that was included in the design hotels promotion.

Reviews.Title: “Effortless brilliance”
Reviews.Author: SweetandSalt
Reviews.Content: With it's effortless service and discreet luxury , The Mandala will always be our hotel of choice, when visiting Berlin. Sure it's modern and chic, but not without a deep sense of personality and warmth. It's feel clean and crisp, and not at all dated. The Mandala does what not many design hotels can; it has a near perfect combination of function and form. So once again we want to thank all the staff on duty over New Year's Eve, for doing what you do so well; taking excellent care of us and making us want to return to your lovely hotel soon again. Adam & Charlotte

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Central location”
Reviews.Author: SHJMAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandala hotel for seven nights and found it to be a pleasant hotel.Don't be put off by the lobby it is small, but rooms are spacious, clean and well serviced. Staff are quite friendly and helpful. The breakfast was outstanding and has everything you could ask for. As we were on a long trip the washing machine and dryer came in handy for washing clothes.The mandala is in a very good location if you want to see Berlin, close to most sights, decent restaurants, shops and train stations. Overall this is a fairly decent hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The Mandala Hotel in Berlin is an awsome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Alma0730
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom were both very nice. The service as well as breakfast was great!! If we're going to Berlin again we will certainly stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Everything perfect, until I tried to sleep on the bed”
Reviews.Author: genluxx
Reviews.Content: I have travelled fairly often for business and I was so impressed by the service and the decor and layout of both the hotel itself and the hotel room. I thought it was perfect. There was a lot of space and some fairly nice touches, like the bath that would fit two people, the desk that had plenty of room around it and chairs on both sides, the granite kitchen area, most of all the frequency modulator that blocked stray radio frequencies and I could actually feel the difference upon walking into the room, it felt so very peaceful. So in all it was perfect. That was until I went to bed. I had a queen bed with the softest mattress I have ever slept on, so in the morning my back was wrecked, same for my neck after trying to sleep on pillows so soft and fluffy but that disintegrated inside once you lay upon them, and a single duvet ontop of the queen bed, something I found neither stylish or comfortable. I called for more pillows and another duvet, and they obliged, but it was pointelss sleeping on a queen bed with only the room to move under the thin width of a single duvet. So it looked great, but for me the most important thing in a hotel room is the bed, and because of this very reason, I'll never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of tranquility in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: sunshineVienna
Reviews.Content: When I entered the lobby of this design hotel it gave me the impression to be narrow. The rooms are however pretty big, very comfortable and timeless in style. What I found most amazing is that there were -besides a huge flat TV screen- CDs in the room with relaxing music, interesting books (novels) and magazines. I had a room with a kitchenette (which I didin't use) and a huge balcony towards a quiet backyard. The bathroom is huge and modern. They have a nice breakfast room, very stylish with palm trees and great food selection. Staff was very friendly. Another advantage of this hotel is also the proximity to the underground (2 minutes walk). The Brandenburger Tor and "Unter den Linden" can be easily reached by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Promised so much but failed to deliver”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaT75
Reviews.Content: The Mandala aspires to excellence but disappoints in service. With well-appointed rooms, beautiful interiors, a newly renovated spa and a smiling staff you'd think this hotel had it all. Unfortunatley that wasn't the case during our stay. To begin with they couldn't find our reservation. Three people at the front desk spent 15 minutes not finding it. I was then directed to their customer computer to find the reservation myself. Too bad their computer was out of order. I suggested that they call the site we used to book the room This came as an unexpected idea. At first they were reluctant...the lines might be busy (?!) but eventually the manager decided to give it a go. We were then sent to the bar for a complimentary coffee while they sorted things out. At this point approx. 45 minutes had passed since our arrival. 15 minutes later someone arrived to tell us that they had located out reservation: it had been "lost in the system" but the manager with his "special computer" had been able to retrieve it. Sigh. She tells us that the room is made up for one but that they'll immediately send someone up to prep it for two. Four hours later no one has arrived. We call reception and they send someone up. However, for the rest of our stay there is still only one bathrobe and one set of slippers. In the beautiful newly renovated spa I'm hoping to get a massage so I go up to look at the different treatments available. A week after their new opening they have no brochures or any other printed material about which treatments they offer. They seem puzzled by me (all 7 of them staring at me when I ask for some information) and the spa manager promises to send something to my room. 3 hours later (and too late for me to book a treatment) a thick manilla folder arrives full of information. Lastly, the bar. Which I love! Wonderful drinks and a nice ambience! We order the After Work special which they've advertised and receive champagne cocktails. After another drink and dinner (excellent kitchent) we receive our bill. The price for the After Work special is 11 euros whereas it was advertised at 5 euros. When I ask the waitress she looks confused and goes to speak with the bartender. She returns and informs us that there is no After Work special, only a Special drink of the day (full price). So while the hotel is lovely and the staff is very polite and helpful, the actual service level falls far short of what the hotel aspires to and promises. Not a tragedy, but it certainly detracts from the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike07
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, the rooms are massive, especially if you get a suite. We were there for the marathon so booked well in advance, but had such a fantastic room. Very spacious and ideal for a toddler to crawl around, make noise and not cause mischief. One of the best hotels/apartments I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best experiences”
Reviews.Author: pengemex2
Reviews.Content: The lobby is very small so I had a great surprise when I saw the apartman I rented. Beautiful. Stylish furniture, big spaces, music from the walls. Great-great hotel in a very central location.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, great location”
Reviews.Author: mojohomer
Reviews.Content: What a surprise upon arrival.......when I entered the small lobby, I thought this was going to be one of those boutique hotels that only looked nice on websites...but it wasn't like that when we got into our huge room. There's a living area separate from the big comfortable bed, and also a separate office area....the bathroom was huge ase well. The room was extremely comfortable and the decorations are very classy. The location is right by the Sony Center but a bit far from the main shopping area. I would stay at this hotel again when I visit Berlin...the size of the rooms can't be beat in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suites”
Reviews.Author: AJDuke
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mandala for 6 days in April/May 08. It was my first trip to Berlin and I found the hotel very centrally located to explore the whole city with easy access to public transportation. Potsdammer Place is not especially charming but there are good restaurants nearby and many sights are within walking distance. The hotel itself has excellent suites and the morning breakfast spread is delicious. The staff was generally helpful, although the reception area is tiny so there is not much room to linger if you need to discuss travel or restaurant plans. The workout area and spa upstairs are light filled and a welcome refuge from the busy-ness outside the hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A classy, nice hotel in an excellent locaiton”
Reviews.Author: sandybot
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Mandala, to be found right at the Potsdamer Platz, over a weekend. My room was called an executive suite, located on the 6th floor. It was very spacious, especially the bathroom and the walk-in clothes closet, and arranged in a very pleasing way. Additionally, my room featured a balcony which looked out the back of the hotel onto a brick building and a very quiet street. Small touches made it especially comfortable for me - the swivel tv (so it wasn't a flatscreen, but still), the CDs, the books in the shelves. Everything was clean and crisp, and the AC was making sure that I wasn't dying of heat (37° C). I was a little miffed at the price for the WLAN, considering you can get it free right across the street in the sony center (an amazing new complex!!!), or at a number of coffee or food chains, but I guess you can't have it all. The staff at the front desk were well schooled and very helpful. Unfortunately, the spa on the 11th floor is being renovated so I did not get a chance to experience anything of that sort. The spa in the sister hotel is available for use, however. I also enjoyed a couple of drinks and dishes in the first floor lounge, and thought both the lounge and the food were excellent (and again, most attentive staff). The area itself is one of my favorites in berlin - everything is new and modern, and shopping/dining is plentiful around here. To summarize - if you get a good deal for the weekend, it is definitely a hotel you should stay at. I know I will if I come to berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Mandala Hotel - Perfect Elegant Getaway in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Strepsils
Reviews.Content: We've just stayed for 4 nights in the Mandala Hotel on Potsdamer Platz and have to say it was an amazing hotel with a huge room, excellent staff and a great friendly atmosphere. We booked into an executive suite which was easily the biggest hotel suite I've stayed in. The room was split into 3 with a large desk/sitting room area with a swivelling television, then the bedroom area with a massive bed and lovely firm foam mattress and then a massive bathroom which is easily as big as some hotel rooms I've stayed in! Not only did it have a huge bath, but it had 2 massive sinks, a separate toilet area and a massive walk in shower in a wet room area. It was extremely good value for money at 180 Euros a night! When we arrived it was 30 degrees and we were given cold towels at reception! The staff were excellent and tended to our every needs. The area around the hotel is safe with the Sony Center just over the road if you want to pop across for a drink or light dinner. It's also around 1 minutes walk to the Potsdamer S & U Bahn which means you're only minutes away from any place in Berlin! It's also quick and easy to walk north from the hotel to the Jewish Memorial, Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag...all within 5-10 minutes easy walk. We had breakfast included in our room and I would recommend doing this as it's 24 Euros per person if you dont! The breakfast is however, excellent, with around a choice of 8 different homemade juices (carrot and orange, yum!), excellent breads and meats and a wide choice of cereal and fruit. Breakfast on the weekends is served until 12, which was a massive bonus for lazy people like myself! Overall, the location and quality of this hotel are second to none. The room was fantastic, the service was fantastic, the food in the Qiu lounge bar was amazing and overall this is a great place to stay for a visit to Berlin. If and when we go back, we will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “huge room, well-located”
Reviews.Author: bikerprof
Reviews.Content: Near Potsdamer Platz. Easy access to key tourist sites. Room very large, and useful kitchen area. Staff had good English. First class experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: clikk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandala for a business conference in Berlin - I don't know what level of room we had booked but the price was €250 and it was enormous! There was a large living area with table, work desk, sofa and chairs, a kitchenette, 2 bathrooms and the bedroom. The two balconys had no seating so didn't really use them. Staff throughout the hotel were generally very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was good, but pricey (although i never had the eggs so can't comment on the cooked breakfast). Also didn't use the gym/spa area so no comments on that. Only complaints were air conditioning in the room which was pretty loud so i left it off most of the time, and pillows with not enough stuffing! Otherwise i can highly recommend this hotel which is in a great location. Cocktails at the Qui bar in the hotel were also good!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice !”
Reviews.Author: hemdale
Reviews.Content: Near Postdamer Platz, this very nice hotel has a strong modern touch. Nicely decorated, a very convenient kitchen (who will cook in such a hotel ?) and an amazing room ! My overall opinion is : JUST GREAT ! Downside: the comforter/blanket fits only one person...if you like wide and big comforters, you'll need two of them. No big deal...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location. Wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: totheworld
Reviews.Content: We could not have been more happy with our stay at the Mandala Hotel. First, the location: Perfect in every way and within walking distance of many of the historical sites in Berlin. We were lucky enough to have great weather during our stay in April, so we could walk to Museum Island, Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, "embassy row," etc. Foodwise, we were able to eat both at Qiu and Facil. If you have the means and the inclination for fine dining, we highly recommend a dinner at Facil. Wonderfully prepared food in an elegant setting with beautiful service. They also were excellent in working with my husband's nut allergy, changing the preparations of 3 of the 4 dishes on the tasting menu. The wines were also wonderful--if you don't want a bottle, the sommelier recommendations by the glass are outstanding. Qiu also serves lovely food, but is not necessarily going to be your destination dinner place--you won't be disappointed if you go there, though, if you are tired after a busy day. We stayed in a Management Suite, which featured tons of closet space (more than enough for 2 people) and a super-large bathroom. The largest hotel room we have stayed in while in Europe. There was even a small terrace (no seating here--though we didn't ask for chairs, so I don't know if they are available). We were really delighted by the quality of the accomodations and the modern decor. This is not the place for someone who wants an "old world" setting, however. Service was efficient and polite. Enjoy your stay at the Mandala!

Reviews.Title: “Potsdamer platz best”
Reviews.Author: darkloop
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend decided to spend a long weekend in Berlin, as we have never before been to this city. We choose Mandala hotel through a Design hotels chain because of it`s central location between the old easter and western parts of the city. Potsdamer platz, where the Mandala hotel is situated has the most central location. Just a 5 minute walk to the Holocaust`s memorial and Brandenburg`s gate. Around 10 min to go to the Gallery Lafayette and Q206 shopping malls. The hotel itself is very clean and has a homey feeling. We had a suite which had a huge marble bathroom with a balcony. The room is very airy and has lots of light and even the fully equipped kitchen. At Mandala they also have a very nice restaurant Facil. The only unpleasant experience was a hotel`s spa and gym. Though it was not the hotel`s fault. When we were in the sauna/bar area(2 girls actually) men didn`t seem to notice us and took an open shower and visited sauna naked. That was quite embarrassing, so we just left the spa/gym area. All in all the hotel is really nice! We would recommend it if you visit Berlin for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TBUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the 2007/2008 New Year and booked it primarily due to the proximity to the Brandenburg Gate (a 10-minute walk) which is the focus of the New Year (Silvester) celebrations. It was wonderful to know that we were such a short walk away at the end of the night. We also got our own personal fireworks display at our hotel window courtesy of folks on the street below. The hotel is bang opposite the Sony Centre at Potsdamer Platz and you can easily hop on the U-bahn (underground/subway) to get to other locations like the Ku'damm for shopping/the zoo or Alexanderplatz in the east. We booked an Executive Suite at the Mandala. The room was huge, with a small kitchenette, large bedroom with desk and sofa, and a large bathroom with a big bath, perfect for wallowing in after a cold day of sightseeing. The room was stylish and modern in decor, as is the whole hotel. Breakfast was included in our room, and we had it every day, in the Facil restaurant, although if we had to pay to 23 Euro charge (per person!), we would have opted to make something in our room instead. The buffet was immaculately presented, with staff constantly topping up food supplies and making sure everything was perfectly aligned (no, I'm not kidding) and all labels pointing in the right direction. You could order hot food from the staff, who all seemed to speak six languages. On our first night, we'd had an early start and just wanted to relax with a DVD in our room and some pizza. The staff helped us to find a DVD in English from their library (bring your own...most are German) and ordered pizza from a local restaurant for us. They were very helpful. The only criticisms we could find were a) the pillows, which were typical German/European and far too thin to be effective and b) the housekeeping staff, who seemed to ignore the electronic "Do Not Disturb" signs when it suited them. Otherwise, it was on the pricey side but we spent a lot of time in the room and the location was great, so I'd say it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing*****”
Reviews.Author: joshy
Reviews.Content: fantastic central location right outside the Sony Centre! I was on the 11th floor with a Balcony and right beside the gym and the Solarium which was relaxing. Cds in the room for different moods, desk for office work and a robe to go back and forward to the Solarium in. Staff were extremely friendly and always had a smile on their face... Highly recommended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Little_Miss_Trouble
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin for five days on business. I stayed at the Mandala. I found the hotel facilities and the staff excellent. All of the staff spoke good English and were very helpful - from rebooking flights to providing me with sellotape and recommending an interesting walking route. I stayed in one of the business suites. It was a well thought out design that allowed for separate sleep and working areas. The room included a kitchenette, lounge area, desk, bedroom and bathroom area. The most impressive aspects of the hotel were the details: the desk was spacious and had network cables, plenty of electricity points (at desk level!), and was complete with the office necessities (highlighters, post it notes, stapler etc); the hallways and lobbies feature interesting photos and art; and most importantly there was no noise from neighbouring rooms. I can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm...”
Reviews.Author: RH777
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a great weekend in Berlin, made all the better for staying at the sublime Mandala hotel. We booked a 'management suite' on a booking website for a fair bit cheaper than the rates advertised on the Mandala's own - and it was really good value for money. Despite being right on Potsdamer Platz, our room was very quiet and perfectly relaxing - a real pleasure to go home to at the end of the day! It's tastefully furnished to a high standard, and the bathrooms are enormous (as was the bed). We didn't have a chance to try the Spa on the 11th floor, but the prices looked reasonable. The food and drink we had there was all very good and we found the staff to be really polite and helpful. Breakfast (at 23 Euros a head) is a little steep, but you can't fault the food and it'll keep you going 'til the evening! We'll definitely go back to Berlin and the Mandala and I wholeheartedly recommend it as a base for exploring the city - Reighstag, Brandenburg Gate and Unter den Linden are all within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect........”
Reviews.Author: GingerGrouseLargs
Reviews.Content: This is the most fabulous place to stay, 5 star quality with 5 star prices, but you get what you pay for. This was a birthday treat for my partner and we loved every minute of the hotel and Berlin. We dined in Facil (booked months in advance so that we got in) on the Friday night and what a meal.....to die for, the best service ever. The restaurant is extremely expensive, but if it is a special occasion, well worth it. Location superb and they upgraded us to a top floor room with a huge balcony. Vielen Danke Mandala, we loved you and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but very poor management”
Reviews.Author: BOBDNYC
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Berlin after we booked two 5 day packages for this hotel through LuxuryLink. Since each package included a dinner at their restaurant (Facil) I had emailed the hotel to make certain that the reservations had been made and for which nights, as I had requested in March when I booked the stay. Two days before we left, I received an email stating that the restaurant was closed. After a game of email tag, they wrote that they agreed to book us in another restaurant. Fine. When we arrived, the staff was very nice and helpful, held our luggage for us, gave us some tips, brought us towels to freshen up, etc. Couldn't have been nicer. Then it all fell apart. They also did not mention that the hotel was being renovated. Drilling and hammering started at 8:30 a.m. and paint fumes filled the halls to the point of giving us a headache. Also, try getting a newspaper delivered to your room. They finally got it right by the time we left. The final straw was trying to book the second dinner. The first one they arranged was great - Vox which I highly recommend. I kept asking whether we could book the second dinner for the night before we left. After much hand wringing from the staff let me know that the manager would need to approve it. I kept repeating taht the package included two dinners. They kept telling me that the manager would call. That never happened. Finally one morning there was a note on the desk which I found after coming out of the shower. It indicated that they would allow us a second dinner at Le Forbourg restaurant at 8pm. Now the manager's tone of “allowing us” was annoying since we paid for his as part of the package. Long story to short, the restaurant had no reservation or idea of any arrangement. It was very embarrassing. Sitting down to what was one of the worst meals in Berlin (we never had the chance to order wine, needed a flare to get a waiter, basically inedible food, you get the idea), we were out of there in a half an hour. The front desk at the hotel apologized said they’d take care of it. After waiting for three hours for a response from the manager, I finally camped out in the lobby to wait for him (Herr Schaeffer). He first said that he tried to speak with me and there was no answer at our room, which was a lie since we sat there for three hours. Then he basically told me that there's nothing he could do, they'd pay for that meal at that restaurant, not arrange another and blamed the entire episode on Luxury Link. Then proceeded to tell me that the restaurant did indeed have a reservation for us and that there was a miscommunication. THEN he proceeded to tell me that they had placed phone calls me to letting me know that the restaurant was closed and that they were renovating.This was not the case and his accusitory tone was at best rude, at worst innappropriate. His lack of customer care was a nightmare. I Seems like he had someone to blame for everything - including us! If you’re going to offer a package, don’t make the clients feel like welfare cases by using the amenities, Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Second experience.”
Reviews.Author: AnnaKiev
Reviews.Content: It was our second experience. This time was much beter then last time. Comfortable place with clever management .Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, well designed rooms”
Reviews.Author: Globaladventure
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a quick, overnight business trip to Berlin - so not much time to experience all aspects of the hotel. A good position in the 'new centre' of the city. Not much of an entrance to the hotel, with a small lobby. Check in was quick and efficient. The bedrooms are great. Spacious, well designed and stylish decor. There is even a small kitchen area in the room - which I would presume is great for a long stay. The entertainment choices are quite domestic (not many English channels on offer). Oversized bathrooms are also a another plus. The bar is quite small, but nicely designed and perfect for a quick drink, before heading out to enjoy the city. I only experienced the restaurant for breakfast - which was very good. The restaurant is a 'glass block' in the central courtyard - a chic start to the day. Definately a good recommendation for travellers who like to shy away from the 'chain hotel' experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: PortiaAnn
Reviews.Content: The Potsdamer Platz area itself is amazing, must be seen to believe the incredible modern architecture that has arisen in such a short time after the Wall came down. Well this hotel with its unassuming facade is perfect in every way, Superior location, convenient to trains, S and U Bahn, fabulous new shopping arcade and wonderful abundance of restaurants, not to mention the Sony Center, Lego Land, German Movie Museum all directly across the street. Hotel itself is ultra modern, enormous rooms, some of which have balconies, which over look a quiet inner green area. Our room for three had a separate desk/bed area for our son with his own balcony, so we lucked out with two balconies. Rooms are more than twice the size of your typical standard European hotel. Gigantic bathroom also, with bathrobes and slippers of course, good water pressure too. Didn't get a chance to eat in the restaurant, breakfast was not included , but many places nearby. Great night club around the corner, "Adagio" and Italian restaurant Essenza on corner. Would certainly return, prime location, excellent staff and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THE MANDALA, BERLIN”
Reviews.Author: traveladdictLugano
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Mandala in Berlin, in the hearth of Potsdamerplatz, just in front of the Sony Center and few steps away from many cultural points and sites of interest. Brand new hotel with all facilities. Just take note that some rooms do not have air-con, during hot season better ask for it. Excellent breakfast in the Facil Restaurant with excellent food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Can you imagine that some guests want to live on the 10th floor?”
Reviews.Author: AdventurerHamburg
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at Dorint Sofitel and Lux 11, I decided to try another design hotel. I have different feelings about it. Actually I was expecting room upgrade, because American express website ( I have fa platinum card) offered a promotion in coop with this hotel, and the upgrade was offered when mntioning Amex code/ So the stuff at the reception told me that have heard nothing about such a promotion. Ok. Then I was shown the room. It was exactly the opposite from what I have expected. It was Executive Suite. But it had no Potsdarm Views which I have requested. And the colour scheme of the room was too frog-like. So the guy from the reception has brought some of our luggage, and I have inquired about the possibility to change the room, because it was different from my expectations. The guy was very good-looking as for Berlin. But sometimes I have the feeling that those super good-looking people should earn their money in some other services. He said, " Yes, some people also want to live on the 10th floor, what shall we do then?" Actually, I see myself no surprise that some people want to live on the 10th floor, because it's demand-supply world, and they have every right (if they pay) to live on the 10th floor if they have requested it and noone said it's not possible beforehand. I did not want to live on the 10th floor, I wanted to have the room with a view on Potzdarmer Platz. So after talking to the reservation department, I was offered to change rooms next day. And the next room we had was a dream. It was a corner suite with all the views possible, nice business colour scheme, and I was feeling great there. So when reserving something at Mandala, do not expect they will take your wishes into account, because some people also "want to live on the 10th floor". Isn't that horrible?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Pnuts
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel for a weekend and it was great. it is on the door step of Potsdamer Platz so very central to lots of sights. the rooms are very clean and roomy. the hotel staff are very friendly and helpful and would certainly recommend hiring the bikes at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotelhoppa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for sightseeing - it's not just for business travellers! It's right near Potsdamer Platz train station so you can take full advantage of Berlin's public transport. The staff at reception were so helpful during our stay (especially when they found out a well known airline left our suitcases in Heathrow!). Just literally round the corner there is a shopping arcade with shops, restaurants and cafes! Lovely! Recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “5 star service, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: legals81
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I are just back from a wonderful stay in the Mandala Hotel. If you want to get away to relax this it place to go, so much so that my friends and I started referring to it as "our oasis of calm". Although this Hotel does not have a big lobby it is very tastefully decorated and the suite we had was more like an apartment with bedroom, two bathrooms, a kitchenette, study/seating area and Balcony. Everything was spotlessly clean and our rooms were made up to perfection everyday. Its also in a great location, the Sony Centre is across the road and its right next to the Potsdamer Platz S Bahn and U Bahn Stations. There is also a shopping centre at the back of the Hotel. I've read some of the previous reviews about the staff being unfriendly, i cant believe it, they were more than lovely to us. They organised a birthday cake for my friend's birthday, gave us a free bottle of champaign, advised us about where best to go out in Berlin, gave us umbrellas for the rain, gave us dvd's to watch in our room. They greeted us and waved us goodbye everytime we went in and out of the Hotel. The service was second to none. By the third day they new all our names and on our last night we got complementary glasses of champaign at the bar. We ate in the restaurant twice, once for breakfast, which was amazing and once at the Michelin star restaurant Facil which was out of this world. I've eaten in a lot of restaurants and never experienced service or food like it. I cannot recommend this Hotel highly enough, we were very sad to leave and will definitely be returning to our "Oasis of Calm"!

Reviews.Title: “A disaster waiting to happen...”
Reviews.Author: L&MCork
Reviews.Content: After check-in we were shown to our room which turned out to be a garden studio when we had booked (& paid for in advance) a management suite. Nobody told us at any point that we were not being allocated our correct room & it was only when we were shown to our room & queried the type of room given that we were told that the hotel was being refurbished & that this was the only room available. After much discussion and disappointment we were finally assured that we would be upgraded the following night & given a complimentary bottle of champagne. There were no other rooms available on our day of arrival. Totally dissatisfied with the deception & lack of customer focus on arrival we felt we had no option but to accept this offer. First morning in our new suite we were woken at 7.00 a.m. to the sound of drills and constant hammering. Following our call to reception we were told that the hotel was undergoing 'emergency essential maintenance' & there was nothing they could do. Basically, we had to put up with the noise and disturbance. However, the same occurred on day 2 and day 3 - at precisely the same time! In the meantime, on day 2 we discovered a bag of dirty working clothes behind the curtains in our room - obviously overlooked by housekeeping & not a very good indication of their levels of cleanliness! The bathroom only had one bathrobe, one pair of slippers, insufficient shampoo & shower gel & was generally shabby. Overall, we were extrememly disappointed with our stay in The Mandala. We paid for and expected 5-star service & accommodation but actually experienced far less. The staff were cold & uncaring and really did little to ease the problems we encountered. Stay there at your peril!! For us - never again.......

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, beautiful, handsome hotel”
Reviews.Author: glee31
Reviews.Content: Mr. O took me to Berlin for a surprise weekend. We booked into The Mandala Hotel on the Potsdamer Strasse. There is also another Mandala Hotel but I reckon the location of the one we choose was best suited to the purpose of our break which was to sample the atmosphere of the German Xmas markets and do some shopping. As soon as our taxi pulled up in front of the Hotel the Concierge greeted us and took our bag for us to Reception. Then once we had checked in, he again took receipt of our bag and escorted us to our room; one of the Management Suites on the sixth floor. This included a kitchen, a walk in wardrobe, a living room with Study area, a patio terrace with views overlooking the Christmas Market below and two further built in wardrobes. I could move in there tomorrow!! The concept of the hotel is to create a home away from home and it certainly achieves that goal and then some. The bed was very comfortable and the great thing is in the morning there is not a sound to be heard from House Keeping going about their chores; no knocking your door or vacuuming the room next door, etc. Also a television placed mid centre of the room swivelled to allow one to watch television either from the couch or from the bed; not that we had much chance to watch television as there was so much else to do. Accompanying this was a powerful Grundig stereo system with a handful of music CD's to get one in the right mood. The restaurant on the fifth floor was full on the first morning so we had breakfast in the bar on the first floor which offered a wide selection of different beverages; fruit juices, lattes, cappuccinos, green tea etc. There was a wide selection of breads, cheeses, cold meats, different types of spreads and also one could order hot food from the kitchen; eggs, waffles (not to mention the small little fruit tarts and mini chocolate cakes!!). We managed to have a table in the restaurant the following day and the surrounding was absolutely fabulous; the sun came in through the glass roof top and also there were some very ornate interesting water displays. They had thought of everything including small stools for ladies to put their handbags on; which all restaurants should have as who wants to put their Bottega Veneta on the floor!! As guests of the hotel, we had access to the Wellness Spa and Fitness Lounge; located on the top floor of the hotel. In the Sauna Room there was a big window offering great panoramic views across Berlin. Also the walls were adorned with very sexy prints of men throughout which would make one sweat even if the work-out didn't; it couldn't have been more exciting!! Also there were Laundry Rooms on all the floors which housed a washing machine and dryer and an iron and ironing board, so one could do one's last minute ironing if needs be before one headed out into Berlin. There was even a television in the Laundry Room which one could watch while the Laundry was being done. The hotel's location is great; it's very close to a lot of the main cultural & political places of interest; the Holocaust Memorial, the Brandenburg Gate, the Reichstag, Checkpoint Charlie, the Tiergarten, the Sony Centre, etc. And not forgetting of course the Potsdamer Strasse itself. Also everything was within easy reach either by foot or by metro; the U-Bahn. Furthermore the market just outside the hotel was one of the best Markets we saw on our trip and to have it literally at one's doorstep was such a treat. There were ski slides and various other forms of entertainment at the market and Mr. O and I had great fun going down the ski slope on big inflatable rubber tyres. This is one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed in and we will definitely book into the Mandala Hotel again if we are back in Berlin which seems a certainty after this wonderful trip. G Lee

Reviews.Title: “Is that really the price?”
Reviews.Author: TorbenB
Reviews.Content: When I made my reservation for this hotel, I genuinely thought there had to be a catch. How could such a nice-sounding room cost so little? I decided to give it a try. My 80 sq-meter room was spectacular (literally): kitchenette, living room, nice bedroom, and of course a terrace. The hotel restaurant is set in a garden and has a calming feeling. (Unfortunately, it didn't have enough room for breaifast, so the overflow had to eat in the hotel lounge--still nice, though.) Location's not in the throbbing heart of town, but there's still enough going on, and it is close to the U-bahn. And if you get such a great room for EUR 210 per night (I treated myself), does it matter? Take advantage of this hotel and its prices while you can!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: xinasaint
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about what a wonderful stay we had at the Mandala Hotel. First off, the hotel is very stylish and hip with a gorgeous lobby and lounge. The staff was friendly and attentive but no overly so. We were delighted that upon check in that we were upgraded to a HUGE suite. I have never seen a hotel room that was so large. It had a kitchenette, living room with dining area, bedroom with office and a huge marble bath. It also had a giant walk-in closet to store our things, which was just great. And when we thought there couldn't be more, we open the curtains to reveal a 30 ft balcony! With the relatively low rate we were paying we thought there must be some mistake and that someone was going to show up and tell us we were in the wrong room! We also appreciated that the room was immaculately clean, the pillows and bed were heavenly, and the decor of the room was very modern and fashionable. Also fashion and architecture magazines were provided for us which was a nice touch. The location was okay. Potsdamer Platz is a newly developed area with lots of great architecture however as another person mentioned, it is not near any of the cool nightlife or shopping. However taxis were always available outside the hotel and a giant U-Bahn station was right there. Also there is a big mall in the Potsdamer Plaz complex which was handy when we needed to find a drugstore, grocery store or quick bite to eat.. Overall this hotel was an amazing value for the money and would not stay anywhere else in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Anon_Traveller_UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a up and coming area of Berlin, where people are on the go 24/7 - its great for nightlife. The staff were friendly and provided an excellent service. The room was clean, a good size, and there were all amenities needed and more - including a kitchen area. I was surprised by the quality of this hotel for it price, and would reccomend it to anyone!
